message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.RO 

The paper proposes a deep neural network model for egocentric activity recognition that uses a spatial attention mechanism to attend to regions containing objects correlated with the activity. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper uses a convolutional LSTM for spatio-temporal encoding of the video, which further supports the likelihood of it belonging to the machine learning sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of a pre-trained CNN for generic image recognition, which suggests that it may belong to the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. Finally, the paper evaluates its model on standard egocentric activity benchmarks, which suggests that it may also belong to the multimedia (cs.MM) and robotics (cs.RO) sub-categories.
